title: Fostering Japanese young proposers
description: 問題は、日本にはカタリストの提案者が少ないことです。なぜなら、日本のADAホルダーは普通の投資家であり、モチベーションの高い起業家ではないからです。

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
Yes the problem is that Japan has few Catalyst proposers

Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
Yes it does

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes it does

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
Yes goals and metrics have been stated clearly

Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes they fall within its scope, to increase Catalyst proposers in Japan

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes it can.
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
Yes.The proposer has provided references but there are no links. 

Are these links sufficient?
No, as there are no links.

Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
No

Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
No but based on their stated experience they are competent to host meetings.

Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
Yes he has laid out his team in detail. We have no idea about their experience or competence in blockchain technology


Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
Yes he has

Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
It is somewhat clear but some items seem over priced. On what basis has the cost per slide been calculated?  Salaries for supervision of slides seem very high for one hour of work.


IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
The budget is very high and could be set more reasonably to achieve set goals.


Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
No. They state that some of this funding will be deferred to later.

Have you verified this plan?
No


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
Yes its realistic

Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
Yes

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Yes

Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
Technical aspects involve presentation of slides at Townhall meetings and breakout rooms

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
No
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
Yes. The roadmap and scope of activities are listed.

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
Yes.  No of participants at a seminar, new proposers at a seminar, increase overall number of proposers 
I suggest that more KPIs be requested from the proposer.

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
No

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
Has not planned

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No

f6_assessments.q0:
the idea is perfect, the only reason I am putting three stars is that there are projects which are addressing the "whole world" rather than a selected group, therefore the efficiency of such a proposal is definitely lower, than a proposal with a larger target group.

Nevertheless, if the target group of the Japanese community is big, it will prevail over lower stars. If not, then the efficiency would be low anyway. 

Please take it as my attempt for constructive opinion, no criticism.
f6_assessments.q1: the proposal can be implemented successfully, I did not find any complications, since the idea is the host seminars.
f6_assessments.q2: strongly agree, that you can keep the records of the newcomers and number of participants at sessions to verify the success.

solution: 解決策としては、モチベーションの高い若い起業家を募り、育て、次のCatalystに向けて新しいアイデアを提案できるようにすることです。
experience: 私はブロックチェーンの起業家を目指している学生で、日本のコミュニティでCatalystの講義をするのに十分な経験を持っています。
